content:
Validator 3 demonstrating that you should take the first string if several have the same max average has no equivalent IDE testcase.

Edit: the fifth string "whichone" was coming up as max average in testcase 3, while it seems the intent was for the two strings "average" and "egareva" to do so instead. I changed the case of some letters in testcase 3 to make it test what it is actually supposed to.
Already accepted, fair enough, note however that this is an harder variation of https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/6225a0bc78303a00236df74219ba707f98f
I have significant doubts that this is suitable for reverse mode. It might be possible, but it surely doesn't seem fun or intuitive.
You are right. I wasn't sure about that either, so I'll remove it. Thanks!
Even more when in a test case, 4 words end with "e", this is hard to guess (Multiple words)
